something called a heterogeneous treatment effect and what that means is you run a big experiment you have a treatment group
and a control group and traditionally you would look at just kind of the mean differences between the two groups but if you have a lot of descriptive
characteristics about the people in those two lists you can see what type of subgroups are actually different after the
treatment as opposed to just the mean difference you can see who's actually more treatment responsive by running a model
traditionally you'd run two linear models and you'd compare them against each other but that's not going to give you a very good answer
